com.fasterxml.clustermate.client.operation

Class OperationResult<T extends OperationResult<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fasterxml.clustermate.client.operation.OperationResult<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    OperationResultImpl

    public abstract class OperationResult<T extends OperationResult<T>>
extends Object
    Class used for returning information about operation success (or lack thereof).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected OperationResult() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract OperationConfig getConfig() 
      abstract int getFailCount() 
      abstract Iterable<NodeFailure> getFailures() 
      abstract NodeFailure getFirstFail() 
      abstract int getIgnoreCount() 
      abstract Iterable<ClusterServerNode> getIgnoredServers() 
      abstract int getSuccessCount() 
      abstract boolean succeededMaximally()
      Simple accessor for checking whether call succeeded as well as it could; meaning that no further calls should be made, even if more nodes were available.
      abstract boolean succeededMinimally()
      Simple accessor for checking whether call succeeded to minimum degree required, or not.
      abstract boolean succeededOptimally()
      Simple accessor for checking whether call succeeded well enough that we may consider it full success.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • OperationResult

    • Method Detail

      • getConfig

        public abstract OperationConfig getConfig()

      • succeededMinimally

        public abstract boolean succeededMinimally()
        Simple accessor for checking whether call succeeded to minimum degree required, or not. This means that we had at least minimal required number of succesful individual calls.

      • succeededOptimally

        public abstract boolean succeededOptimally()
        Simple accessor for checking whether call succeeded well enough that we may consider it full success. We may either choose to do more updates (if nodes are available); up to succeededMaximally() level; or just return and declare success.

      • succeededMaximally

        public abstract boolean succeededMaximally()
        Simple accessor for checking whether call succeeded as well as it could; meaning that no further calls should be made, even if more nodes were available.

      • getFailCount

        public abstract int getFailCount()

      • getIgnoreCount

      • getIgnoredServers

        public abstract Iterable<ClusterServerNode> getIgnoredServers()

      • getFirstFail

        public abstract NodeFailure getFirstFail()
